question:
The government has granted the “Institute of Eminence” status to 14 institutions this year. Consider the following statements about this scheme:
  1. The scheme’s objective is to bring 20 Indian Institutes into the top 500 across the world.
  2. It grants a fund of 1000 crore INR to the private institutes named as such.
  3. Once granted the title, National Institutes of Importance will cease to be regulated by their parent Act.
  4. The IoE title is granted only to existing institutes.
Which of the above statements are correct? Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Institute of Eminence scheme was launched to improve the higher education sector in India. Under this scheme, the government will identify 20 institutes, 10 each from the public and the private sector, as IoEs and provide concessions- pecuniary and regulatory- to aid their entry into the top 500 ranks of world renowned institutes. Statement 2 is incorrect: The IoE scheme does not give funding support to private institutes. It only provides concessions in terms of lesser regulations. The scheme also allows the institutes to frame their own syllabus, set fees, etc. The scheme provides 1000 crore INR to public institutes. Statement 3 is incorrect: Certain institutes are declared to be of national importance under various government acts. They would continue to function under these acts even after being declared IoE. They would, however, enjoy greater flexibility. Eg: IITs established under the Indian Institutes of Technology Act, 1961. Statement 4 is incorrect: The scheme provides for including not only established and well performing institutes, but also green-field institutes. Under this category, proposed institutions can also apply for IoE tagging. These institutes have to provide their development plan for 15 years. It must also satisfy conditions like possession of land, capital, etc.  If it satisfies these criteria, it receives a ‘letter of intent’ and after 3 years of proven operation, receives the IoE tag. This year, Airtel’s Satya Bharti Foundation was added under the list.
